official-title.#text:
To make 15 percent across-the-board rescissions in
		  non-defense, non-homeland-security, and non-veterans-affairs discretionary
		  spending for each of the fiscal years 2013 and 2014.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Across-the-board rescissions
			 in non-defense, non-homeland-security, and non-veterans-affairs discretionary
			 spending for each of fiscal years 2013 and 2014

text.#text:
There is hereby rescinded an amount equal to 15
			 percent of—

the budget
			 authority provided (or obligation limitation imposed) in each of the fiscal
			 years 2013 and 2014 for any non-defense, non-homeland-security, and
			 non-veterans-affairs discretionary account in any fiscal year 2013 or 2014
			 appropriation Act;

the budget authority provided in any
			 advance appropriation for each of the fiscal years 2013 and 2014 for any
			 non-defense, non-homeland-security, and non-veterans-affairs discretionary
			 account in any prior fiscal year appropriation Act; and

the contract authority provided in each of
			 the fiscal years 2013 and 2014 for any program that is subject to a limitation
			 contained in any fiscal year 2013 or 2014 appropriation Act for any
			 non-defense, non-homeland-security, and non-veterans-affairs discretionary
			 account.

term.#tail:
means any discretionary account, other
			 than—
term.#text:
non-defense, non-homeland-security, and non-veterans-affairs
			 discretionary account

header.#text:
Non-Defense,
			 Non-Homeland-Security, and non-Veterans-Affairs discretionary
			 account

text.#text:
any account
			 included in a Department of Defense Appropriations Act;

any account included in a Department of
			 Homeland Security Appropriations Act;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
included in a
			 Military Construction and Veterans Affairs and Related Agencies Appropriations
			 Act; or

defense activities included in an Energy and Water Development and Related
			 Agencies Appropriations Act.

text.#text:
to each
			 discretionary account and each item of budget authority described in such
			 subsection; and

within each such
			 account and item, to each program, project, and activity (with programs,
			 projects, and activities as delineated in the appropriation Act or accompanying
			 reports for the relevant fiscal year covering such account or item, or for
			 accounts and items not included in appropriation Acts, as delineated in the
			 most recently submitted

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take effect immediately after the
			 enactment of such Act.

text.#text:
In the case of any fiscal year 2013 or 2014
			 appropriation Act enacted after the date of enactment of this section, any
			 rescission required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget
Committees on Appropriations of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report specifying the account and amount of each rescission made
			 pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Within 30 days after the date of enactment of this section
			 (or, if later, 30 days after the enactment of any fiscal year 2013 or 2014
			 appropriation Act), the
